questions: Q. 1. What are the twin characteristics of growth?
answers: Ans. Increase in mass and increase in number of individuals are the twin characteristics of growth.

questions: Q. 2. What is the difference between the growth of living and non-living things?
answers: Ans. In non-living things growth occurs from the outer side whereas in living organisms growth is from the inner side.

questions: Q. 3. What do you understand by the term metabolism?
answers: Ans. The sum total of all the chemical reaction occurring in an organism is known as metabolism.

questions: Q. 4. Give any two defining characteristics of living beings.
answers: Ans. Metabolism and consciousness are two defining characteristics of living beings.

questions: Q. 5. What does ICBN stand for?
answers: Ans. ICBN stands for International code of Botanical Nomenclature.

questions: Q. 6. Define nomenclature.
answers: Ans. The system of providing organism with appropriate and distinct names is called nomenclature.

questions: Q. 7. Who is known as the father of Botany?
answers: Ans. Theophrastus is known as the father of Botany.

questions: Q. 8. What is the need of taxonomy?
answers: Ans. Taxonomy makes the identification of organisms and their study more convenient.

questions: Q. 9. What is biochemical systematics?
answers: Ans. The classification of plants and animals on the basis of biochemical characteristics is called biochemical systematics.

questions: Q. 10. Who introduced the term species?
answers: Ans. John Ray.

questions: Q. 17. What is hierarchy of categories?
answers: Ans. It is defined as sequence of categories in a decreasing or increasing order from kingdom to species and vice versa. Kingdom is the highest rank followed by division, Class, Order, Family, Genus and Species.

answers: Ans. Species is the unit of classification.

questions: Q. 19. What is the difference between monotypic and polytypic genus?
